value.name: REGULAR_EDUCATION
value.desc: Regular educationâ€”A program that provides students from the prekindergarten level to grade 12 with learning experiences that focus primarily on knowledge and skills for the appropriate age or grade level of students. This contrasts with that designed to improve or overcome physical, mental, social, and/or emotional disabilities.

value.name: SPECIAL_EDUCATION_SERVICES
value.desc: Special Education Servicesâ€”A service, specially designed and at no cost to the parent/guardian, that adapts the curriculum, materials, or instruction for students identified as needing special education. This may include specially designed instruction for students with any of the following: autism, deaf-blindness, developmental delay (to age 9), hearing impairment, mental retardation, multiple disabilities, orthopedic impairment, serious emotional disturbance, specific learning disability, speech or language impairment, traumatic brain injury, visual impairment, and other health information.

value.name: EARLY_IDENTIFICATION
value.desc: Early identificationâ€”A service that develops and implements a formal plan for identifying a disability as early as possible in a child's life.

value.name: EARLY_INTERVENTION
value.desc: Early interventionâ€”A service that: 1) is designed to meet the developmental needs of each child eligible under Part C of the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act (IDEA) of 1997 and the needs of the family related to enhancing the childâ€™s development; 2) is selected in collaboration with the parents; 3) is provided under public supervision by qualified personnel; 4) is in conformity with an individualized family service plan; and 5) is offered at no cost, unless federal or state law provides for a system of payments by families, including a schedule of sliding fees; and 6) meets the standards of the state.

value.name: AUTISM
value.desc: Service for individuals with autismâ€”A service of instruction or services for students with a developmental disability significantly affecting verbal and non-verbal communication and social interaction, generally evident before age three, which adversely affects educational performance. Characteristics of autism include irregularities and impairments in communication, engagement in repetitive activities and stereotyped movements, resistance to environmental change or change in daily routines, and unusual responses to sensory experiences. This does not include services for children with characteristics of the disability

value.name: DEAF_BLIND
value.desc: Service for individuals with deaf-blindnessâ€”A service of instruction or services for students with concomitant hearing and visual impairments which cause such severe communication and other developmental and educational problems that an individual with deaf-blindness cannot be accommodated in special education services solely for deaf or blind individuals.

value.name: MENTAL_RETARDATION
value.desc: Service for individuals with mental retardationâ€”A service of instruction or services for students with significantly subaverage general intellectual functioning existing concurrently with deficits in adaptive behavior that is manifested during the developmental period, which adversely affects an individual's educational performance.

value.name: HEARING_IMPAIRMENT
value.desc: Service for individuals with hearing impairmentâ€”A service of instruction or services for students with either: 1) a hearing impairment which is so severe that an individual is impaired in processing linguistic information through hearing with or without amplification (which would be considered to be a state of deafness), and which adversely affects his or her educational performance; or 2) a hearing impairment whether permanent or fluctuating (which would not be considered to be a state of deafness) that adversely affects an individual's educational performance.

value.name: VISUAL_IMPAIRMENT
value.desc: Service for individuals with visual impairmentâ€”A service of instruction or services for students with a visual impairment which, even with correction, adversely affects an individual's educational performance. This includes service for both partially seeing and blind individuals.

value.name: ORTH_IMPAIRMENT
value.desc: Service for individuals with orthopedic impairmentâ€”A service of instruction or services for students who have a severe orthopedic impairment which adversely affects an individual's educational performance. The term includes impairments caused by congenital anomaly (e.g., clubfoot or absence of some member), impairments caused by some disease (e.g., poliomyelitis or bone tuberculosis), and impairments from other causes (e.g., cerebral palsy, amputations, and fractures or burns which cause contractures).

value.name: SPEECH_IMPAIREMENT
value.desc: Service for individuals with speech or language impairmentâ€”A service of instruction or services for those students who have a communication disorder such as stuttering, impaired articulation, and language or voice impairments which adversely affect an individual's educational performance.

value.name: EMOTIONAL_DISTURBANCE
value.desc: Service for individuals with serious emotional disturbanceâ€”A service of instruction or services for: 1) those individuals exhibiting one or more of the following characteristics over a long period of time and to a marked degree, which adversely affects an individual's performance:

value.name: LEARNING_DISABILITIES
value.desc: Service for individuals with specific learning disabilitiesâ€”A service of instruction or services for those students who have a disorder in one or more of the basic psychological processes involved in understanding or in using language whether spoken or written, which may manifest itself as an imperfect ability to listen, think, read, write, spell, or perform mathematical calculations. This includes services for individuals with such conditions as perceptual impairments, brain injury, minimal brain dysfunction, dyslexia, and developmental aphasia; but does not include individuals who have learning problems which are primarily the result of visual, hearing, or motor impairments, mental retardation, emotional disturbance or environmental, cultural, or economic disadvantage.

value.name: MULTIPLE_DISABILITIES
value.desc: Service for individuals with multiple disabilitiesâ€”A service of instruction or services for those students who have concomitant impairments (e.g., mental retardation-blind or mental retardation-orthopedic impairments) which cause such severe educational problems that an individual with multiple disabilities cannot be accommodated in special education services s olely for one of the impairments. This does not include deaf-blindness.

value.name: BRAIN_INJURY
value.desc: Service for individuals with traumatic brain injuryâ€”A service of instruction or services for those individuals that acquired injury to the brain caused by an external physical force, resulting in total or partial functional disability or psychosocial impairment, or both, that adversely affects a child's educational performance. The term applies to open or closed head injuries resulting in impairments in one or more areas, such as cognition; language; memory; attention; reasoning; abstract thinking; judgment; problem-solving; sensory, perceptual, and motor abilities; psychosocial behavior; physical functions; information processing; and speech. The term does not apply to brain injuries that are congenital or degenerative, or to brain injuries induced by birth trauma.

value.name: PSYCHOLOGICAL_SERVICE
value.desc: Psychological serviceâ€”A service that includes 1) administering psychological and educational tests, and other assessment procedures; 2) interpreting assessment results; 3) obtaining, integrating, and interpreting information about child behavior and conditions relating to learning; 4) consulting with other staff members in planning school programs to meet the special needs of children as indicated by psychological tests, interviews, and behavioral evaluations; 5) planning and managing a program of psychological services, including psychological counseling for children and parents; and 6) assisting in developing positive behavioral intervention strategies.

value.name: CROSS_CATEGORICAL
value.desc: Cross categoricalâ€”A service of instruction or services that focuses on more than one specific type of disability and in which individuals with different types of disabilities are served.

value.name: DEVELOPMENTAL_DELAY
value.desc: Service for individuals with developmental delayâ€”A service of instruction or services for students who are experiencing developmental delays in one or more of the following areas: physical development, cognitive development, communication development, social or emotional development, or adaptive development.

value.name: OTHER_SP_ED
value.desc: Otherâ€”Other special education service which cannot be classified above.

value.name: VOCATIONAL_EDUCATION
value.desc: Vocational educationâ€”Organized educational programs offering a sequence of courses that are directly related to the preparation of individuals for paid or unpaid employment in current or emerging occupations requiring other than a baccalaureate or advanced degree.

value.name: AGRICULTURE
value.desc: Agricultureâ€”A vocational program that prepares students with the knowledge, skills, and understanding necessary to enter a wide range of agriculturally related occupations.

value.name: CONSUMER_AND_HOME-MAKING
value.desc: Consumer and home-makingâ€”A vocational program that prepares students with the knowledge, skills, and understanding relevant to personal, home and family life.

value.name: MARKETING
value.desc: Marketingâ€”A vocational program that teaches about the promotion and distribution of goods and services from the producer to the consumer including appropriate utilization.

value.name: HEALTH
value.desc: Healthâ€”A vocational program that prepares students with the knowledge, skills, and understanding necessary to enter a wide range of occupations that support health professionals.

value.name: TECHNOLOGY_INDUSTRIAL
value.desc: Technology/industrial artsâ€”A vocational program that prepares students with the understanding about all aspects of industry and technology. These activities include experimenting, designing, constructing, and evaluating; using tools, machines, materials; and using processes which may help individuals make informed and meaningful occupational choices, or may prepare them to enter advanced trade, industrial or technical education programs.

value.name: OCCUPATIONAL_HOME_ECONOMICS
value.desc: Occupational home economicsâ€”A vocational program that prepares students with the knowledge, skills, and understanding relevant to occupational home economics.

value.name: BUSINESS
value.desc: Businessâ€”A vocational program that prepares, upgrades, or retrains students for selected business occupations.

value.name: TECHNICAL
value.desc: Technicalâ€”A vocational program that prepares students for job opportunities in a specialized field of technology.

value.name: TRADE_AND_INDUSTRIAL
value.desc: Trade and industrialâ€”A vocational program that prepares students for initial employment in a wide range of trade and industrial occupations.

value.name: OTHER_VOCATIONAL_EDUCATION
value.desc: Other vocational educationâ€”Other vocational education activities that cannot be classified by the categories above.

value.name: TECHNICAL_PREPARATORY
value.desc: Technical preparatoryâ€”A program that offers four-year planned sequence of vocational-technical instruction beginning in the eleventh year of high school. The sequence extends through two years of postsecondary occupational education or an apprenticeship program of at least two years following secondary instruction, and culminates in a certificate or associate degree.

value.name: HEAD_START
value.desc: Head Startâ€”A federally funded child development program that provides health, educational, nutritional, social, and other services primarily to economically disadvantaged preschool children, including Indian children on federally recognized reservations, and children of migratory workers and their families; and involves parents in activities with their children so that the children will attain overall social competence. Examples of Head Start demonstration projects include Comprehensive Child Development Program, Family Service Centers, and Head Start/Public School Early Childhood Transition Projects.

value.name: EVEN_START
value.desc: Even Startâ€”A program that provides family-centered education projects which help parents become full partners in the education of their children, assists children in reaching their full potential as learners, and provides literacy training for their parents. The purpose of this program is to integrate early childhood education and adult education for parents into a program that builds on existing community resources.

value.name: MIGRANT_EDUCATION
value.desc: Migrant educationâ€”A program of instruction and services for those children who move periodically with their families from one school to another in a different geographical area in order that a parent or other member of the immediate family may secure seasonal employment.

value.name: INDIAN_EDUCATION
value.desc: Indian educationâ€”A program of instruction and services for those children who are American Indian or Alaskan natives.

value.name: COMPENSATORY_DISADVANTAGED
value.desc: Compensatory services for disadvantaged studentsâ€”A program of instruction and/or services which is designed for economically disadvantaged and/or academically challenged children. Services primarily consist of educational support services, counseling, and other supplemental non-instructional support.

value.name: BILINGUAL_EDUCATION_PROGRAM
value.desc: Bilingual education programâ€”A program of instruction and services that uses more than one language to teach a content area. Students served by this program may or may not be proficient in English.

value.name: CURRICULUM_CONTENT_IN_NATIVE
value.desc: Curriculum content in native languageâ€”A program in which instruction and academic content are taught in a student's native, non-English language.

value.name: DEVELOPMENTAL_BILINGUAL
value.desc: Developmental bilingual educationâ€”A program in which students with the same non-English language background receive language arts and content area instruction in both the student's native language and English.

value.name: NATIVE_LANGUAGE_SUPPORT
value.desc: Native language supportâ€”A program in which reading is initially taught in both the students' non-English home language and their second language (English) until their English is proficient enough for them to participate successfully in a regular classroom. Use of the non-English home language is phased out as regular English instruction is gradually phased in. This is also known as transitional bilingual education.

value.name: TWO-WAY_BILINGUAL_EDUCATION
value.desc: Two-way bilingual educationâ€”A program in which native English-speaking and non-native-English speaking students are placed together to receive language arts and content area instruction in English and another non-English language.

value.name: ENGLISH_AS_A_SECOND_LANGUAGE
value.desc: English as a second language (ESL) programâ€”A program of instruction and services in which students identified as limited English proficient are placed in regular immersion instruction for most of the school day but receive extra instruction in English for part of the day. This extra help is based on a special curriculum designed to teach English as a second language and to develop the student's ability to use the English language in an academic setting. The non-English home language may or may not be used in conjunction with ESL instruction.

value.name: CONTENT_ESL
value.desc: Content ESLâ€”A program of language development that goes beyond the teaching of basic vocabulary and grammar skills, and is designed to parallel English language instruction for native speakers in content and approach; English vocabulary and mechanics are often embedded in engaging content and/or literature.

value.name: GIFTED_AND_TALENTED
value.desc: Gifted and talentedâ€”Programs that provide special educational opportunities including accelerated promotion through grades and classes and an enriched curriculum for students who are endowed with a high degree of mental ability or who demonstrate unusual physical coordination, creativity, interest, or talent (often in the visual or performing arts).

value.name: COCURRICULAR_PROGRAMS
value.desc: Cocurricular programsâ€”A program of activities that are related to the current curriculum in which a student is enrolled. This may be any type of school-sponsored activity designed to provide opportunities to participate in experiences on an individual or group basis (at school or public events) for the improvement of skills. The following characteristics apply to cocurricular activities: 1) participation is necessary for meeting class requirements, for credit, or for graduation; 2) sessions are conducted at regular and uniform times during school hours, or may be conducted during authorized non-school hours; 3) programs are directed or supervised by instructional staff in a learning environment similar to that found in classes offered for credit; and 4) services are primarily or totally funded by school-operating funds for general instructional purposes under the direction and control of local education authorities.

value.name: ATHLETICS
value.desc: Athleticsâ€”School-sponsored activities, under the guidance and supervision of school staff, that provide opportunities for students to pursue various aspects of physical education.

value.name: ADULT_CONTINUING_EDUCATION
value.desc: Adult/continuing educationâ€”A program of instruction provided by an adult/continuing education instructional organization for adults and youth beyond the age of compulsory school attendance.

value.name: ADULT_BASIC_EDUCATION
value.desc: Adult basic educationâ€”A program which provides learning experiences concerned with providing the fundamentals to adults who have never attended school or who have not completed formal schooling. These individuals need knowledge and skills to raise their level of education to increase self confidence and/or self determination, to prepare for an occupation, and to function more responsibly as citizens in a democracy.

value.name: ADULT_ENGLISH_AS_A_SECOND
value.desc: Adult English as a second languageâ€”A program which provides learning experiences for adults with a non-English background to develop the English language skills necessary to successfully participate in an English-speaking environment.

value.name: ADVANCED_ADULT_BASIC_EDUCATION
value.desc: Advanced adult basic educationâ€”A program which provides learning experiences designed to develop the knowledge, skills, understanding, attitudes, and behavioral characteristics considered to be needed by adults who may or may not have completed formal schooling. These individuals have accepted adult roles and responsibilities and are preparing for postsecondary careers and/or postsecondary education programs.

value.name: LIFE_ENRICHMENT
value.desc: Life enrichmentâ€”A program which provides learning experiences offering skills, knowledge, and understanding designed primarily for enjoyment without regard to a vocation.

value.name: OCCUPATIONAL
value.desc: Occupationalâ€”A program which provides learning experiences offering the knowledge, skills, and understanding required to prepare learners for immediate employment in an occupation or cluster of occupations.

value.name: RETRAINING_FOR_NEW_OCCUPATION
value.desc: Retraining for new occupationâ€”A program which provides learning experiences offering skills, knowledge, and understanding required for preparation for employment in a new and different occupation.

value.name: SPECIAL_INTEREST
value.desc: Special interestâ€”A program which provides learning experiences offering the skills, knowledge, and understanding required to prepare adults for a subordinate occupation in addition to their vocation. Such programs also are referred to as avocational programs.

value.name: UPGRADING_IN_CURRENT_OCCUPATIO
value.desc: Upgrading in current occupationâ€”A program which provides learning experiences offering the skills, knowledge, and understanding designed primarily to extend or update workers' competencies for occupations in which they are employed.

value.name: GENERAL_EDUCATIONAL_DEVELOPMEN
value.desc: General Educational Development (GED) preparationâ€”A program which provides learning experiences designed to develop the knowledge, skills, and understanding required for the successful completion of the Test of General Educational Development (GED).

value.name: OTHER_ADULT_CONTINUING
value.desc: Other adult/continuing educationâ€”Other adult/continuing education program which cannot be classified in any of the categories above

value.name: COMMUNITY_JUNIOR_COLLEGE
value.desc: Community/junior college education programâ€”Postsecondary education institutions, commonly organized into two-year programs, which offer instruction that has usually been adapted in content, level and schedule to meet the needs of the community in which they are located. Community or junior colleges generally offer a comprehensive curriculum which includes basic liberal arts, science, occupational, general education and adult education components. The program awards an Associate of Arts (A.A.) certificate to those who successfully complete the requirements.

value.name: COMMUNITY_SERVICES_PROGRAM
value.desc: Community services programâ€”A program of activities which are not directly related to the provision of educational services in a school system. These include services provided to the community as a whole or some segment of the community.

value.name: CIVIC_SERVICES
value.desc: Civic servicesâ€”A program of activities concerned with providing services to civic affairs or organizations. This includes services to parent-teacher association meetings, public forums, lectures, and civil defense planning.

value.name: COMMUNITY_RECREATION
value.desc: Community recreationâ€”A program of activities concerned with providing recreation for the community as a whole, or for some segment of the community. This includes such staff activities as organizing and supervising playgrounds, swimming pools, and similar programs.

value.name: COORDINATION_OF_CASEWORK
value.desc: Coordination of caseworkâ€”A program of activities designed to manage the counsel and aid given to individuals and families requiring assistance of social service agencies.

value.name: CUSTODY_AND_CHILD_CARE
value.desc: Custody and child care servicesâ€”A program of activities pertaining to the provision of programs for the custodial care of children in residential day schools, or child care centers which are not part of, or directly related to, the instructional program, and where the attendance of the children is not included in the attendance figures for the school or school system.

value.name: PUBLIC_LIBRARY_SERVICES
value.desc: Public library servicesâ€”A program of activities pertaining to the operation of public libraries by a school or school system, or the provision of library services to the general public through the school library. This includes such activities as budgeting, planning and augmenting the library's collection in relation to the community, and informing the community of public library resources and services.

value.name: WELFARE_ACTIVITIES
value.desc: Welfare activitiesâ€”A program of activities pertaining to the provision of personal needs of individuals who have been designated as needy by an appropriate governmental entity. These needs include stipends for school attendance, salaries paid to students for work performed (whether for the school, school system, or for an outside source), and for clothing, food, or other personal needs.

value.name: OTHER_COMMUNITY_SERVICES
value.desc: Other community servicesâ€”Other community services program provided to the community which cannot be classified above.

value.name: SUBSTANCE_ABUSE_EDUCATION
value.desc: Substance abuse education/preventionâ€”A program that provides a variety of services including: 1) individual, group, and/or family counseling; 2) knowledge and skill-enhancing activities; and 3) structured groups that focus on family dynamics, problem solving, self-esteem, and/or similar issues . These programs care for students who are at risk of drug abuse, for example, those who are currently in an experimental stage (light use), who have family members or peer groups who use alcohol or drugs, or who have behavioral, emotional, or other problems at home, in school, in the community, or with the criminal justice system. Substance abuse education programs also offer presentations about the risks of substance use to students at their schools as well as in various other community settings.

value.name: STUDENT_RETENTION
value.desc: Student retentionâ€”A program that develops and implements educational strategies and practices including special instructional methods and materials to encourage students to remain in school and complete their elementary and secondary education.

value.name: EXTENDED_DAY_CHILD_CARE
value.desc: Extended day/child care servicesâ€”A program that provides custodial care of students enrolled in a school or system before school day starts and/or after a school day ends.

value.name: COUNSELING_SERVICES
value.desc: Counseling servicesâ€”A program that helps a student to better identify his or her perceived educational, personal, or occupational potential; relate his or her abilities, emotions, and aptitudes to educational and career opportunities; use his or her abilities in formulating realistic plans; and achieve satisfying personal and social development.

value.name: IMMIGRANT_EDUCATION
value.desc: Immigrant educationâ€”A program of instruction and services designed and implemented especially for those children who have immigrated to the United States.

value.name: COLLEGE_PREPARATORY
value.desc: College preparatoryâ€”A program that provides learning experiences that focus primarily on knowledge and skills considered to be needed by students desiring further education in postsecondary education. These experiences are usually achieved in secondary education.

value.name: INTERNATIONAL_BACCALAUREATE
value.desc: International Baccalaureateâ€”A program established to provides an internationally recognized, interdisciplinary, pre-collegiate course of study. Its curriculum is designed to qualify students, especially those who are internationally mobile, for college admission. Upon completion of this program, a student may receive an International Baccalaureate diploma.

value.name: MAGNET_SPECIAL_PROGRAM
value.desc: Magnet/Special Program Emphasisâ€”A school within the public education system that has been designed: 1)to attract students of different racial/ethnic backgrounds for the purpose of reducing, preventing, or eliminating racial isolation; and /or 2)to provide an academic or social focus on a particular theme (e.g., science/math, performing arts, gifted/talented, or foreign language).

value.name: ALTERNATIVE_EDUCATION
value.desc: Alternative educationâ€”An instructional program that: 1) addresses needs of students which cannot typically be met in a regular school/program; 2) provides nontraditional education; 3) serves as an adjunct to a regular school; and 4) falls outside of the categories of regular, magnet/special program emphasis, special, or vocational/technical education.

value.name: LIBRARY_MEDIA_SERVICES
value.desc: Library/media servicesâ€”A program that provides library and media services to students and school staffs. Services include selecting, acquiring, cataloging, classifying, circulating, and maintaining library materials; furnishing reference and bibliographical services; selecting music, films, or other audio-visual materials for programs.

value.name: HEALTH_SERVICES
value.desc: Health servicesâ€”A program that provides physical and mental health services which are not direct instruction, including medical, dental, and nursing services provided for students.

value.name: REMEDIAL_EDUCATION
value.desc: Remedial educationâ€”A program that is designed to develop specific cognitive skills, usually in language arts or mathematics, from a deficient level to one that is appropriate to the educational abilities and aspirations of the student.

value.name: SCHOOL-TO-WORK_OPPORTUNITIES
value.desc: School-To-Work Opportunitiesâ€”A program that meets the system components which: 1) integrates work-based and school-based learning; 2) integrates occupational and academic learning; 3) provides linkages between secondary education and postsecondary education/job opportunity; and 4) is a partnership involving participation of educators, employers, governments, local communities, and other public or private organizations. The purpose of this program is to assist youths in making effective transitions from school to career-oriented work. Program examples include tech-prep education, career academies, youth apprenticeships, cooperative education, school-to-apprenticeship, business-education compacts, and school-sponsored enterprises.

value.name: SERVICE_LEARNING
value.desc: Service learningâ€”A program that is designed to help students develop a deeper understanding of academic subjects through participation in meaningful service to their school or community.

value.name: OTHER
value.desc: Otherâ€”Other programs which cannot be classified above.
Resident of administrative unit and usual school attendance area
Resident of administrative unit, but of other school attendance area
Resident of this state, but not of this administrative unit
Resident of an administrative unit that crosses state boundaries

element.name: Code
element.desc: The general racial category which reflects the individual's recognition of his or her community or with which the individual most identifies.

element.name: Proportion
element.desc: A percentage associated with the race.

value.name: PACISLANDER
value.desc: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

object.name: Reference
object.desc: References external content via a URL.

attribute.name: MIMEType
attribute.desc: MIME type to indicate the content type to be expected when retrieving the external content.

attribute.name: Description
attribute.desc: Contains an optional description of the content or a processing hint with regard to its structure (e.g. named standard, file layout or XSD). Contents may be mandated in instances of this type, or types that follow the AbstractContentPackageType pattern.

element.name: URL
element.desc: Location of external content.

element.name: Code
element.desc: Code representing the relationship.

element.name: Code
element.desc: Code indicating the residency status for this enrollment.

element.name: PublishInDirectory
element.desc: Indicates whether or not this school contact's information should be published in a directory of school information.

element.name: Code
element.desc: Specialized instruction or related / transitional service provided to this student.

value.name: RELATED_SERVICE
value.desc: Service is a related service (e.g. speech / language, vision)

value.name: FAMILY_TRAINING_COUNSELING
value.desc: Family training, counseling, and home visits

value.name: MEDICAL_SERVICES_ONLY_FOR
value.desc: Medical services only for diagnostic or evaluation purposes

value.name: VOCATIONAL_REHABILITATION
value.desc: Vocational rehabilitation training and job placement

value.name: REFERRALS_FOR_MEDICAL
value.desc: Referrals for medical, dental, and other health services

value.name: ASSISTANCE_WITH_PARTICIPATION
value.desc: Assistance with participation in school programs

value.name: OBTAINING_OR_TRANSFERRING
value.desc: Obtaining or transferring records necessary for enrollment

value.name: PARENT_EDUCATION_RELATED_TO
value.desc: Parent education related to rights and resources for children

value.name: ADDRESSING_NEEDS_RELATED_TO
value.desc: Addressing needs related to domestic violence

value.name: CLOTHING_TO_MEET_A_SCHOOL
value.desc: Clothing to meet a school requirement

value.name: REFERRAL_TO_OTHER_PROGRAMS
value.desc: Referral to other programs and services

value.name: EMERGENCY_ASSISTANCE_RELATED
value.desc: Emergency assistance related to school attendance

value.name: SPECIALLY_DESIGNED_ACADEMIC
value.desc: Specially designed academic instruction delivered in English

element.name: Code
element.desc: Funding source for the program, may be more than one.

element.name: Code
element.desc: Used for an individual providing the service. Review by state / program, may be required. Service provider title (such as Physical Therapist or Psychologist).

object.name: SoftwareRequirement
object.desc: Contains information about a specific required piece of software.

element.name: SoftwareTitle
element.desc: This is the title of the specific software. This does not include the vendor. For example, Flash not Adobe.

element.name: Version
element.desc: This includes the version of the specific software.

element.name: Vendor
element.desc: This is the vendor of the specific software. For example, Adobe.

element.name: OS
element.desc: This is the operating system and version. For example, Macintosh OS X 1.4.

object.name: SoftwareRequirementList
object.desc: Contains information about required software.

element.name: SoftwareRequirement
element.desc: Contains information about a specific required piece of software.

object.name: SpanGap
object.desc: This element is designed to contain the time period attached to an object. Very long periods (school year, quarter, etc.) and very small periods (second, millisecond, etc.) can be defined. This element provides a scoping description of the time metadata enclosed.

element.name: Code
element.desc: This element provides a place for the application to send structured data (code values, unique identifier, timestamps). This code value can, depending upon the use case agreement between agents, be used to qualify the data in the Value element.

element.name: Name
element.desc: Contains a human-readable description of the value in Value.

element.name: Value
element.desc: Contains the human-readable value.

object.name: StaffParameters
object.desc: Characteristics of the staff person identified by the district which the state uses to perform its matching logic.

element.name: StateProvinceId
element.desc: Specified if the requesting agency believes it knows the personâ€™s state Id.

element.name: LocalId
element.desc: This is the requesting agentâ€™s unique Id for the person.

element.name: SIF_RefId
element.desc: Requesting agencyâ€™s local zoneâ€™s GUID of the personâ€™s data source object.

element.name: SSN
element.desc: Social security number of the person.

element.name: Names
element.desc: The name(s) of the person.

element.name: Addresses
element.desc: he address(es) of the person.

element.name: Demographics
element.desc: Demographic information about the person. This will typically be the core matching information. Privacy considerations may mean that it is filled differently here than it might be in a local object, but it must include enough to drive the state's matching algorithms.

element.name: Contacts
element.desc: Typically used to provide the state information about a person's parents and legal guardians.

element.name: EffectiveDate
element.desc: This should match StudentSchoolEnrollment/EntryDate.

element.name: StartDate
element.desc: Start date for a range that is being requested. In most cases this will correspond to the school entry date.

element.name: EndDate
element.desc: End date for a range that is being requested. In most cases this will correspond to the school exit date.

element.name: OtherIdList
element.desc: Additional person identifiers not represented elsewhere in Characteristics (e.g. the driver's license number of the person ).

element.name: TimeElement
element.desc: SIF_Metadataâ€™s TimeElement may be specified to indicate a time duration to which the characteristics apply (as opposed to adding new elements to Characteristics). This metadata may be supplied by systems that know a student existed in a district during a certain time period (e.g. a system initiating a student record exchange). If the responder is able to make use of the metadata, it may do so to narrow down the student look-up; otherwise the metadata can be ignored or logged.

value.desc: Armed Forces Africa, Canada, Europe and Middle East

object.name: Street
object.desc: The Street element is a complex element that breaks a street address down into several parts

element.name: Line1
element.desc: Address line 1.

element.name: Line2
element.desc: Address line 2.

element.name: Line3
element.desc: Address line 3.

element.name: Complex
element.desc: Name of the complex.

element.name: StreetNumber
element.desc: The address number assigned to the building.

element.name: StreetPrefix
element.desc: Street prefix like NE

element.name: StreetName
element.desc: The name of the street.

element.name: StreetType
element.desc: The type of street. For example, Lane, Blvd., Ave., etc.

element.name: StreetSuffix
element.desc: Street suffix like SW.

element.name: ApartmentType
element.desc: Type of apartment, for example, Suite.

element.name: ApartmentNumberPrefix
element.desc: Apartment number prefix.

element.name: ApartmentNumber
element.desc: The number of the apartment.

element.name: ApartmentNumberSuffix
element.desc: Apartment number suffix.

value.desc: Infant and toddlers program - Early intervention (IDEA Part C)

value.name: SPECIAL_ED_BIRTH
value.desc: Special education services for Birth - Age 2 (IDEA Part B)

value.name: SPECIAL_ED_PRESCHOOL
value.desc: Special education services for preschoolers (IDEA Part B)

value.name: MIGRANT_EARLY_CHILDHOOD
value.desc: Migrant early childhood program (ESEA Title I)

value.name: COMPENSATORY_EDUCATION_FOR
value.desc: Compensatory education for disadvantaged students (ESEA Title I)

value.name: ENGLISH_AS_A_SECOND_LANGUAGE
value.desc: English as a Second Language (ESEA Title III)

object.name: StudentLEARelationship
object.desc:
The purpose of the StudentLEARelationship object is to represent the current information available regarding a single student's relationship/affiliation to a single LEA for a specific school year as of the time a SIF_Event or SIF_Response is generated by the system of record. This object is not designed to operate on a historical/longitudinal basis in the default context.
StudentLEARelationship instances must not span multiple school years.
Only one instance of the StudentLEARelationship object with MembershipType=Home may exist for a specific time interval between EntryDate and ExitDate (inclusive) for a given student, LEA, and school year.
Multiple instances of the StudentLEARelationship object with MembershipType=Concurrent may exist for a specific time interval between EntryDate and ExitDate (inclusive) for a given student, LEA, and school year.
Multiple instances of StudentLEARelationship will occur for specific or overlapping time intervals if a student has affiliations with multiple LEA's. This will most likely be detected during aggregate data collection from multiple LEA's. Since StudentLEARelationship/@RefId and StudentLEARelationship/@StudentPersonalRefId are zone-specific, external mechanisms (e.g. student locator) would be required to correlate multiple instances of a single student affiliating with multiple LEA's.

attribute.name: RefId
attribute.desc: The unique identifier for a particular affiliation between a student and a LEA.

attribute.name: StudentPersonalRefId
attribute.desc: The SIF RefId of the StudentPersonal object to which this instance of StudentLEARelationship refers.

attribute.name: LEAInfoRefId
attribute.desc: The SIF RefId of the LEAInfo object to which this instance of StudentLEARelationship refers.

attribute.name: SchoolYear
attribute.desc: Contains the SIF school year to which this instance of StudentLEARelationship applies. StudentLEARelationship must not span multiple school years.

element.name: MembershipType
element.desc: The type of this affiliation as it relates to the LEA identified in LEAInfoRefId.

element.name: LEARelationshipType
element.desc: An instance of the OrganizationRelationshipType common element that describes the details of the student's affiliation with the LEA.

element.name: EntryDate
element.desc: The date from when this affiliation is valid.

element.name: ExitDate
element.desc: The last school calendar day (membership day) the student was affiliated with the LEA (inclusive).

element.name: NonResidentAttendReason
element.desc: Indicates the reason that the student has an affiliation with this LEA if the student is a not a resident of the LEA.

element.name: GradeLevel
element.desc: The grade or academic level of the student.

object.name: StudentParameters
object.desc: Characteristics of the student identified by the district which the state uses to perform its locator matching logic.

element.name: StateProvinceId
element.desc: Specified if the requesting agency believes it knows the personâ€™s state Id.

element.name: LocalId
element.desc: This is the requesting agentâ€™s unique Id for the person.

element.name: SIF_RefId
element.desc: Requesting agencyâ€™s local zoneâ€™s GUID of the student's data source object.

element.name: GradeLevel
element.desc: The studentâ€™s current grade level.

element.name: SSN
element.desc: Social security number of the person.

element.name: Names
element.desc: The name(s) of the person.

element.name: Addresses
element.desc: The address(es) of the person.

element.name: Demographics
element.desc: Demographic information about the person. This will typically be the core matching information. Privacy considerations may mean that it is filled differently here than it might be in a local object, but it must include enough to drive the state's matching algorithms.

element.name: Contacts
element.desc: Typically used to provide the state information about a person's parents and legal guardians.

element.name: EffectiveDate
element.desc: This should match StudentSchoolEnrollment/EntryDate.

element.name: StartDate
element.desc: Start date for a range that is being requested. In most cases this will correspond to the school entry date.

element.name: EndDate
element.desc: End date for a range that is being requested. In most cases this will correspond to the school exit date.

element.name: GraduationDate
element.desc: ndicates the date the person's graduated Year, Year and Month, or Year, Month and Day may be specified. Intended to facilitate locating persons that may not be currently enrolled in a school or district, particularly in the context of locating student identifiers for initiating a request for a student's academic record. Supplied date values may often be approximations made by the entity endeavoring to request a student's academic record.

element.name: SchoolAttendedName
element.desc: The name of the school last attended by the person.

element.name: SchoolAttendedLocation
element.desc: The location of the school last attended by the person (e.g. city or county name, district name, etc.).

element.name: OtherIdList
element.desc: Additional person identifiers not represented elsewhere in Characteristics (e.g. the driver's license number of the person ).

element.name: TimeElement
element.desc: SIF_Metadataâ€™s TimeElement may be specified to indicate a time duration to which the characteristics apply (as opposed to adding new elements to Characteristics). This metadata may be supplied by systems that know a student existed in a district during a certain time period (e.g. a system initiating a student record exchange). If the responder is able to make use of the metadata, it may do so to narrow down the student look-up; otherwise the metadata can be ignored or logged.

element.name: Contact
element.desc: Typically used to provide the state information about a person's parents and legal guardians.

element.name: ManagingPublicAgency
element.desc: The GUID of the public agency (a district / LEA) to which the "ManagingSchool" reports / belongs.

element.name: ManagingSchool
element.desc: The GUID of the school responsible for coordinating the student's program participation.

element.name: GiftedEligibilityCriteria
element.desc: State / local code used to determine eligibility for Gifted / Talented program.

element.name: StudentParticipationData
element.desc: Collects elements of interest for each StudentParticipation.

element.name: ServiceCategory
element.desc: Category of service (for example, whether it is instruction or a related / transitional service or a supplemental service). Typically designated by a state.

element.name: ServicingPublicAgency
element.desc: The GUID of the public agency (a district / LEA) to which the "ServicingSchool" reports / belongs.

element.name: SchoolWhereServiceDelivered
element.desc: The GUID of the school where the service is delivered.

element.name: AgencyType
element.desc: Identifies an agency or clinic that will provide the specified service.

object.name: StudentPlacementList
object.desc: This list contains information that describes each specific instructional, related or transitional service that has been prescribed or recommended in the program plan developed for a student who has been placed in an individualized special program.

element.name: StudentPlacementData
element.desc: Collects elements of interest for each StudentPlacement.

element.name: StudentRecordExchange
element.desc: The StudentRecordExchange object set for the student and sending agency that was requested by the GetStudentRecordExchange method. The object set is contained in a composite StudentRecordExchangeData object. To allow for packetizing of StudentRecordExchange object sets, there should be one instance of the StudentRecordExchangeData object for each object it contains.

element.name: StudentDemographicRecord
element.desc: The StudentDemographicRecord object referenced by the StudentRecordExchange/Records/StudentDemographicRecordRefId element. At most one of this or one of the other Conditional elements must be provided in a StudentRecordExchangeData instance.

element.name: StudentAcademicRecord
element.desc: The StudentAcademicRecord object referenced by the StudentRecordExchange/Records/StudentAcademicRecordRefId element. At most one of this or one of the other Conditional elements must be provided in a StudentRecordExchangeData instance.

element.name: StudentSpecialEducationRecord
element.desc: The StudentSpecialEducationRecord object referenced by the StudentRecordExchange/Records/StudentSpecialEducationRecordRefId element. At most one of this or one of the other Conditional elements must be provided in a StudentRecordExchangeData instance.

element.name: StudentRecordPackage
element.desc: A StudentRecordPackage object referenced by the StudentRecordExchange/Records/OtherRecords element. At most one of this or one of the other Conditional elements must be provided in a StudentRecordExchangeData instance.

object.name: Students
object.desc: List of students

element.name: StudentPersonalRefId
element.desc: GUID that identifies the student that this element refers to.

element.name: Code
element.desc: The subject area code (i.e. the first two digits of the course classification code)

element.name: SubjectArea
element.desc: Subject matter area or department

value.name: TRADES_AND_INDUSTR
value.desc: Trades and industry (e.g., CADD, electronics repair, mechanics, precision production)

element.name: Code
element.desc: Code for session type.

object.name: TextData
object.desc: Contains arbitrary text, encoded in UTF-8.

attribute.name: MIMEType
attribute.desc: Optional MIME type to specifically indicate the text type. Otherwise text/plain can be assumed.

attribute.name: FileName
attribute.desc: Optional file name to indicate the file from which the content originated, or to suggest a name to use when saving the content.

attribute.name: Description
attribute.desc: Contains an optional description of the content or a processing hint with regard to its structure (e.g. named standard, file layout or XSD). Contents may be mandated in instances of this type, or types that follow the AbstractContentPackageType pattern.

object.name: TimeElement
object.desc: This element is designed to contain the time period attached to an object. Very long periods (school year, quarter, etc.) and very small periods (second, millisecond, etc.) can be defined. This element provides a scoping description of the time metadata enclosed.

element.name: Code
element.desc: This element provides a place for the application to send structured data (code values, unique identifier, timestamps). This code value can, depending upon the use case agreement between agents, be used to qualify the data in the Value element.

element.name: Name
element.desc: Contains a human-readable description of the value in Value.

element.name: Value
element.desc: Contains the human-readable value.
